segments.en: Numbered Discourses 8
7. Earthquakes
69. Assemblies
“Mendicants, there are these eight assemblies.
What eight?

segments.pli: Khattiyaparisā, brāhmaṇaparisā, gahapatiparisā, samaṇaparisā, cātumahārājikaparisā, tāvatiṃsaparisā, māraparisā, brahmaparisā.
segments.en: The assemblies of aristocrats, brahmins, householders, and ascetics. An assembly of the gods under the Four Great Kings. An assembly of the gods under the Thirty-Three. An assembly of Māras. An assembly of Brahmās.

segments.pli: Abhijānāmi kho panāhaṃ, bhikkhave, anekasataṃ khattiyaparisaṃ upasaṅkamitā.
segments.en: I recall having approached an assembly of hundreds of aristocrats.

segments.pli: Tatrapi mayā sannisinnapubbañceva sallapitapubbañca sākacchā ca samāpannapubbā.
segments.en: There I used to sit with them, converse, and engage in discussion.

segments.pli: Tattha yādisako tesaṃ vaṇṇo hoti tādisako mayhaṃ vaṇṇo hoti, yādisako tesaṃ saro hoti tādisako mayhaṃ saro hoti.
segments.en: And my appearance and voice became just like theirs.

segments.pli: Dhammiyā ca kathāya sandassemi samādapemi samuttejemi sampahaṃsemi.
segments.en: I educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired them with a Dhamma talk.
But when I spoke they didn’t know:

segments.pli: ‘ko nu kho ayaṃ bhāsati devo vā manusso vā’ti.
segments.en: ‘Who is this that speaks? Is it a god or a human?’

segments.pli: Dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṃsetvā antaradhāyāmi.
segments.en: And when my Dhamma talk was finished I vanished.
But when I vanished they didn’t know:

segments.pli: ‘ko nu kho ayaṃ antarahito devo vā manusso vā’ti.
segments.en: ‘Who was that who vanished? Was it a god or a human?’

segments.pli: Abhijānāmi kho panāhaṃ, bhikkhave, anekasataṃ brāhmaṇaparisaṃ … pe …
segments.en: I recall having approached an assembly of hundreds of brahmins …
householders …
ascetics …
the gods under the Four Great Kings …
the gods under the Thirty-Three …
Māras …
Brahmās.

segments.pli: Tatrapi mayā sannisinnapubbañceva sallapitapubbañca sākacchā ca samāpannapubbā.
segments.en: There too I used to sit with them, converse, and engage in discussion.

segments.pli: Tattha yādisako tesaṃ vaṇṇo hoti tādisako mayhaṃ vaṇṇo hoti, yādisako tesaṃ saro hoti tādisako mayhaṃ saro hoti.
segments.en: And my appearance and voice became just like theirs.

segments.pli: Dhammiyā ca kathāya sandassemi samādapemi samuttejemi sampahaṃsemi.
segments.en: I educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired them with a Dhamma talk.
But when I spoke they didn’t know:

segments.pli: ‘ko nu kho ayaṃ bhāsati devo vā manusso vā’ti.
segments.en: ‘Who is this that speaks? Is it a god or a human?’

segments.pli: Dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṃsetvā antaradhāyāmi.
segments.en: And when my Dhamma talk was finished I vanished.
But when I vanished they didn’t know:

segments.pli: ‘ko nu kho ayaṃ antarahito devo vā manusso vā’ti.
segments.en: ‘Who was that who vanished? Was it a god or a human?’
These are the eight assemblies.”

suttaplex.blurb: Eight kinds of assemblies: aristocrats, brahmins, householders, ascetics, and various deities. The Buddha has visited each of these in disguise.
